column4: well, i RTFM, installed network manager, and it works like it should... no breakage.  =-(
i even have an acurate signal indicator now....
there was no way I had 100% signal at 300ft from the router!
I can :)
how do u pull that off?
DD-WRT on a Linksys WRT54GL, which lets me set the broadcast strength
u can set it highter that it shipped with?
yes.  Much.  (with safety warning about leaving it as such)
is dd-wrt a linux app? never heard of it.
It's router firmware.
http://www.dd-wrt.com/dd-wrtv2/index.php
is the router a current model? this is Exactly what I need for a client of mine...
Yes.  Note carefully the L at the end of the model name - that is critical.
thanks so much. u have noooo idea how helpful that little tidbit is ti me!!
is it reasonable to want to get 600ft thru 2 residentian walls, no metal siding?
that might be pushing it, but it's worth a try.
a repeater would be smarter
problem is theres nowhere to put one in that distance. trying to connect a church, school, and parsonage (pastors house) together...
Eeep.
eeep?
That sounds pretty tricky.  Can you run wires underground to connect them?
